job_description: System Software Architect - job post Axbio, Inc. Axbio, Inc. in Santa Clara, CA 95054 $208,000 - $365,000 a year -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $208,000 - $365,000 a year Job Type Contract System Software Architect (consultant) AXBIO Inc. is a Silicon Valley startup company developing semiconductor nanotechnology biochips for fast Molecular In-Vitro Diagnostics. Company is well funded and founded by seasonal business and technology experts with broad experience in biotechnology, bioinformatics, IC device development and high-volume semiconductor manufacturing. We are currently seeking a highly motivated and energetic System Software Architect to join our team. A System Software Architect is a professional who designs and oversees the development of system software, which is a type of low-level software that interacts directly with the computer hardware to manage the overall operation of a computer system. They are responsible for defining the architecture of the system software, including the design of the software components, their interfaces, and their interactions. The System Software Architect works closely with other software engineers, hardware engineers, and stakeholders to ensure that the software meets the requirements of the project, as well as industry standards and best practices. They are also responsible for analyzing and resolving technical problems that arise during the development process, and for continuously refining and improving the architecture to meet changing needs. The role of a System Software Architect requires a strong understanding of computer science and software engineering principles, as well as experience in low-level programming, system software development, and project management. Good communication and leadership skills are also important, as the System Software Architect often acts as a liaison between technical and non-technical stakeholders. The Software System Architect is responsible for providing strategic direction and design of integrated system comprising of software and hardware components for Axbio's IVD products, primarily focusing on genome sequencer. In this position the System Software Architect will coordinate the development of the following modules: 1. Equipment software engineering 2. Data preprocessing 3. AI/ML models 4. Bioinformatics pipeline 5. IT and data security 6. Customer and internal portals Required Qualifications PhD or MS in computer science, AI, bioinformatics, or in relevant fundamental science field with minimum 10 years of related work experience. The System Software Architect should have in depth understanding of the development and execution of diagnostics equipment software integration projects, high performance computing in a biotechnology/healthcare/informatics environment, and best practices for ensuring compliance and security. Must have skills: Strong programming skills: Proficiency in low-level programming languages like C and assembly, as well as experience in developing and designing system software. Knowledge of computer architecture: Understanding of computer hardware, including memory management, process management, and input/output systems. Software development methodologies: Familiarity with software development methodologies such as agile development and knowledge of software development tools such as version control systems. Analytical and problem-solving skills: The ability to design and develop complex software systems and to troubleshoot and debug issues that arise. Communication and collaboration skills: The ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, hardware engineers, and project managers. Security: A strong understanding of security best practices and the ability to design secure systems. Familiarity with operating systems: A deep understanding of operating systems and their internals, including process management, memory management, and input/output systems. Leadership and project management skills: The ability to lead cross-functional teams and to manage complex projects from design to delivery. Job Type: Contract Pay: $208,000.00 - $365,000.00 per year Benefits: Flexible schedule Compensation package: 1099 contract Experience level: 10 years Schedule: Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Santa Clara, CA 95054: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Experience: Computer Science: 10 years (Required) Bioinformatics: 10 years (Preferred) Biotechnology: 3 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
